channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for NV
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for NV

item.title: Report X-2023080582
item.description:
Report X-2023080582

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-01
  • City: SPARKS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package wet, corroded at bottom corner. 1 plastic jug out of 4 present leaking from loosened lid. Around 16 fl oz of contents lost. Other jugs undamaged. DescribePack: Plastic cap on jug loosened, releasing contents. DurationRel: 2 and MitigateEffect: Package placed in lined spillage tote, excess spillage wiped up.

item.title: Report E-2023080339
item.description:
Report E-2023080339

Identified by scraper @ 2023-08-29T21:11:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-12
  • City: NORTH LAS VEGAS
  • State: NV
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the one box containing a one gallon poly bladder of a flammable corrosive liquid (un2924) had leaked due to excessive heat from weather conditions and had released 0.5 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.
